title: Sourcegraph extension manifest
description: The Sourcegraph extension manifest describes the extension and the features it provides.

description.description: The extension's description, which summarizes the extension's purpose and features. It should not exceed a few sentences.

publisher.description: The Sourcegraph user or organization name publishing the extension.

icon.description: The icon URL for this extension (data: URIs are OK).

iconDark.description: A dark-mode-friendly icon URL for this extension (data: URIs are OK).

url.description: A URL to a file containing the bundled JavaScript source code of this extension.

repository.description: The location of the version control repository for this extension.

url.description: A URL to the source code for this extension.

directory.description: The directory within the repository that defines this extension.

categories.description: The categories that describe this extension, to help users browsing the extension registry to discover this extension.

tags.description: Arbitrary tags that describe this extension.

activationEvents.description: A list of events that cause this extension to be activated. '*' means that it will always be activated.

contributes.description: Features contributed by this extension. Extensions may also register certain types of contributions dynamically.

items.description: An action contribution describes a command that can be invoked, along with a title, description, icon, etc.

actionItem.description: A specification of how to display this action as a button on a toolbar.

description.description: A description associated with this action item.

iconDescription.description: A description of the information represented by the icon.

iconURL.description: The icon URL for this action (data: URIs are OK).

label.description: The text label for this item.

pressed.description: An expression that, if given, should evaluate to a boolean value specifying whether the action item should be rendered as a pressed button.

category.description: The category that describes the group of related actions of which this action is a member.

command.description: The command that this action invokes. It can refer to a command registered by the same extension or any other extension, or to a builtin command (https://docs.sourcegraph.com/extensions/authoring/builtin_commands).

commandArguments.description: Optional arguments to pass to the extension when the action is invoked.

description.description: A longer description of the action taken by this action. The description should not be unnecessarily repetitive with the title.

iconURL.description: A URL to an icon for this action (data: URIs are OK).

id.description: The identifier for this action, which must be unique among all contributed actions. By convention, this is a dotted string of the form `myExtensionName.myActionName`. It is common to use the same values for `id` and `command` (for the common case where the command has only one action that mentions it).

title.description: The title that succinctly describes what this action does.

configuration.description: The JSON Schema for the settings used by this extension. This schema is merged with the Sourcegraph settings schema. The final schema for settings is the union of Sourcegraph settings and all added extensions' settings.

menus.description: Menu items contributed by the extension.

views.description: Views (which are pages or partial pages) that are contributed by the extension.

items.title: ViewContribution
items.description: A view, which is a page or partial page.

id.description: The identifier for this view, which must be unique among all contributed views. By convention, this is a dotted string of the form `myExtensionName.myViewName`.

where.description: Where the view is displayed. Currently the only supported value is 'global/page' (for views displayed as standalone pages at /views/ID).

searchFilters.description: Search filters contributed by the extension.

items.description: A search filters interface with `name` and `value` to display on a filter chip in the search results filters bar.

name.description: The name to be displayed on the search filter chip.

value.description: The value of the search filter chip (i.e. the literal search query string).

MenuItemContribution.description: MenuItemContribution is a menu item contributed by an extension.

action.description: The action to invoke when the item is selected. The value refers to a {@link ActionContribution#id} value.

alt.description: An alternative action to invoke when the item is selected while pressing the Option/Alt/Meta/Ctrl/Cmd keys or using the middle mouse button. The value refers to a {@link ActionContribution#id} value.

group.description: The group in which this item is displayed. This defines the sort order of menu items. The group value is an opaque string (it is just compared relative to other items' group values); there is no specification set of expected or supported values.

when.description: An expression that, if given, must evaluate to true (or a truthy value) for this contribution to be displayed. The expression may use values from the context in which the contribution would be displayed.
